IdeaMachine.eth
The NFT P.I.G.

The Polygon based NFT P.I.G. (Product Idea Generator) produces a sentence is randomly generated at mint via Chainlink VRF. There are zillions of combinations of sentences so in real time the image and metadata is generated when a mint event is broadcast on the Polygon network. There are no lame reveal schemes. You will see it pop up (maybe not, this is Web3 where UX always sucks). You can always wait a couple minutes and head to your OpenSea account to see your ideas that you minted. (You have no right to complain about anything anyway...It's free, and we are paying your VRF fees.)

Price: Free (Yes, really!)

(Note: The NFT doesn't get minted until the VRF automatically calls back with a second transaction. There are always some blocks worth of lag.)

How the NFTs Look 

This is an example of a possible project idea that the P.I.G. could generate:

Background & Character Count Rarity

Each sentence is randomly generated at mint from a VRF number. The sentence length is tracked in terms of total characters. The background of the image also contains an element of rarity. Gold backgrounds occur 1% of the time, while Silver, Bronze, and Red backgrounds occur more frequently. If you want to learn the exact percentages then RTFC (Read the F-ing Contract). No really, read the contract! This is the habit that prevents approval attacks and other nasty things in crypto. Scams delay adoption and reward those insufferable people talking down to you on Twitter.

This project might seem worthless because it is free to mint, but the lessons you learn understanding the process under the hood can be very valuable someday. That's why this project originated in the Spring 2022 Chainlink Hackathon. There is real value in what is here, but it is up to you to find it.

FAQ

There are no intelligent questions, only greedy people.

IdeaMachine's Project Idea Generator is a Chainlink VRF driven NFT engine that mints random sentences in real time. It takes the piss of pandemic NFT culture. It was the Eternal September of crypto. NFTs aren't going away, but almost every project minted during the pandemic is going to zero...or lower.

This project was created by a single person, me. My name is Woody. I won a prize in the Fall 2021 Chainlink Hackathon with a precursor to this project. The code is fully open source and may be reused by anyone. All rights of the ideas generated go to the person owning the NFT if applicable by law. If you make the next big project thanks to this one, then please give thanks to Chainlink first. They made dumb stuff like this possible.

I've made a lot of great NFT projects that the get rich quick crowd doesn't care about. That's ok, I have been in asset tokenization since 2016 and had a lot of fun around the world meeting down-to-earth crypto people who are in it just for the cocaine and hookers, I mean boring technical seminars. I'm not interested in your money at all because all my friends got stupid rich from flipping absolute garbage in the NFT market, and they front me money when my projects with actual utility inevitably go bust. That's why this project is free to mint. Ideas aren't even worth a dime per 10,000. It's about the joy of wash trading and insider finagling in an unregulated market.

If 10,000 mints take place I will smile for at least 20 seconds. I will happily lose 1 Link to the VRF coordinator monster for this achievement. I will also buy my mother flowers, and my wife earrings of her choice on etsy with a value of up to $15. I'm still paying off the vacuum cleaner I bought her last year for her birthday. Times are tough now.

The price to mint is 0. We even pay the VRF fees for it. Wash trading it back and forth for 0 Matic is highly encouraged!

When your mint transaction is confirmed, that's only the first part. To have the sentences be verifiably random, you must wait for the Chainlink VRF coordinator to call back with the number. This takes some blocks to occur. You may notice a minute or two of lag. It's ok to mint multiple items at once. It won't make a difference.

No. There is no code in the contract that does anything nefarious with approvals. This is not a dumb question to ask as dumb as the project is. Trust nobody. Go audit the confirmed contract on polygonscan.com. While you shouldn't trust my credentials alone, I have been around for a while.

Please Switch to the Polygon Network

You are not logged in to Web3 on the Polygon Network. Please configure your wallet (MetaMask) to enable this chain, and then refresh the page to retrieve Web3 data.

You can add Polygon (Chain ID 137) with one click on ChainList.org if you don't have it already.
